result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob E Baczek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid within 90 days.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 10 days jail consecutive as penalty for failure to pay.
DNA surcharge/sample waived.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob E Baczek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Treatment letter and completion certificate filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jacob E Baczek in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty on count #1 of the amended complaint.     The Defendant was sentenced as follows: FINE: $505.00 to be paid in 90 days or defendant to serve 10 days jail consecutive as penalty for failure to pay.  DNA SAMPLE/SURCHARGE waived based on date of violation.

Stipulation for Adjournment of Trial Date and Order.
  Signed by Judge Aprahamian on 12/9/15.

Jury status hearing at 01-11-2016 08:30 am

From Atty Adams dated 11/24/15 re intent to ask for adjournment of trial at jury status.
Defendant Jacob E Baczek in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney requests matter remain as set.

Defendant Jacob E Baczek in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states his client is in counseling and his last class is December 8, 2015. Defense requests another date in October, 2015. Defense advises there is no solid offer at this time. Court will give a date in late October for review.  Court will also give a jury status/jury trial date. Form given to Attorney regarding motions, jury instructions and witnesses.  Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jacob E Baczek in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting another date in 5 weeks. Defendant is undergoing counseling. Court grants request. Defense to advise on the next date how this matter will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with his spouse.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant can use firearm while on duty.  Defendant can contact the City of Milwaukee to coordinate.  Represenative to be  nominated to pick up guns at City of Brookfield and have them sold.
